xXPPCxsrDBPfCvv6x1VSOg.text: Merry Christmas to us! So my friend and I decide spend Christmas going to a Chinese restaurant. I had seen Wok and Roll many times and wanted to try it out. When we walked in and it looked rather dead but the hostess told us there was no tables available Beyond a 45-minute wait for food if we sat at the empty bar. So we decided to take our chances sitting at the empty bar. My food came out first my friends food came out 15 minutes later. Only half of my order came out when I checked after it after being given no information 15 minutes later I was told that the kitchen was backed up even though there was only two other tables in there besides us and 20 minutes later my food came out. We ask to speak to the manager who started screaming at my friend. I would have to say in my 37 years this is my worst restaurant experience ever and if I could give negative Stars I would give this restaurant a -10 Stars and the food was bad as well as the service. If you have a chance do not ever go to wok-n-roll and please tell all your friends to not ever go as well.

WVkitUN08px3D0eM8hEnUQ.text: Cute restaurant, comfy chairs, but that is where my excitement ended. The service was very poor. Then a few more minutes for them to offer us menus, and then it took 10 more minutes to get water. The wings were okay, but very chewy and tough. They said there was fresh blue fin in but the nigiri did not taste fresh, had very strong odor. If the overall experience had been better I might consider going back, but I just don't have any desire to and wouldn't recommend.

EOwiDxVtzVKjI2dqQlpISw.text: Self proclaimed foodie, and critically acclaimed iron chef, I'm very familiar with Asian food. I have to honestly say, especially after living in LA after 12 years being near somenof the most authentic Asian food in America, the Chow Mein at Wok n Roll is HANDS DOWN THE BEST CHOW MEIN I've ever had. Better than Chinatown in Los Angeles. Yep, I crossed that line and I challenge anyone to put another restaurants chow mein against Wok n Roll. If you're in the mood for noodles, you need to come to this place ASAP. I had the chicken. Perfectly tender meat, vegetables still slightly crunchy, noodles soft but not over cooked, and the sauce right on the money. I will DEFINITELY be back.

DD7coeZJYhcl_cA69tR2lA.text: No. No.......NO  First, this place opened up with a new name/menu in Sept or August of 2018. So all of the older higher reviews should be taken down. I was wanting to like this place.  Why I didn't just go to sushi J (next door which is great) is a mistake I regret.   Just don't.  (Now an Update to my review a week later because the owner responded to me) wow. The owner is delusional. I'm no way associated to a better restaurant nearby. Yet he accuses me of smoking with people from a nearby restaurant. I don't smoke, and I haven't been to sushi J in months. Look at his review, how off is he???   But hey yelpers. Go visit this place and make up your own mind in a mediocre subpar restaurant that is using high yelp reviews from a previous restaurant to up his credibility.

-_qkknEAKdpuHr-UgQE-4Q.text: Nice looking restaurant but food is marginal. Rolls are loosely wrapped and fall apart. Plated nice but the rolls themselves look sloppy. Tempura shrimp was not the best. Some bites had an unusual fishy taste. Green tea was not even warm let alone hot.  Squid salad was really good and a generous portion. No liquor license yet. Probably would not go back.

bKE4LnQScbqIL17hXzp-wg.text: We wanted to try a new sushi place tonight and so we gave this place a try. Suffice to say they have a LONG way to go to meet four or five stars. The server, while polite, was terrible. He forgot to put in our sushi roll orders and when we asked about them half an hour later, he kinda laughed and was like "oops I knew I forgot something." The manager did come over to apologize but his table side manner was more tweeker than professional...constantly messing with his clothes, chewing on his tongue, no eye contact. He said that he would comp half of the food and rush our dinner. The rolls arrive but we're somewhat lackluster. When we had to ask the server for the check rather than having it delivered...less than 20% was comped. Had the manager said he was only going to comp 20% that would have been fine, however, he said that he would comp half and after spending 10 years in the restaurant industry myself, it's the principle of the matter. The issue was resolved eventually but over all the experience left a lot to be desired. Pity since we'd heard good things about the place and had high hopes.

ucZDt9gZ-W-RR0QuB3oZOA.text: Whoever wrote that there is a Saturday "happy hour" is wrong. There is also no liquor license as of 5/28. Nevertheless, the fish was fresh-but not spectacular-though the roll combos were very interesting and good. We tried three. The food is good- it isn't "OMG !!!" great. There is not the scope of nigiri offerings I was expecting-there are maybe 8 nigiri options at dinner. The highest priced sushi rolls were good but for $17 I'm expecting more food and higher quality fish or they need to lower prices on their most expensive rolls by about 10% This restaurant gets five star reviews. It wouldn't get 4.5 stars in a large city where there's an international airport. The sushi in Phoenix can be good. I've yet to experience "great" and I've been to about 4 of the highest reviewed places. I also found it odd that this place wants to sell you 5 pieces of Nigiri and 2 pieces of sushi of a particular fish. Do people really want 5 pieces of the same thing or do they want to mix and match? I like to mix and match so I found that really odd. Id think most people want orders of 2 per order-nigiri or sushi-it doesn't matter- so you can try several types of nigiri. Takeaway- if you're from NYC, LA, Chicago, Miami- you're just not going to find the highest quality flavorful raw fish in Phoenix that you're used to where there are large international airports. So, be honest with yourself and If you live here part of the year you need to decide if you're willing to settle for what passes for "great" sushi in Phoenix, which so far, for me is, is just pleasant or fine. If you're a Phoenix native then yes- this is close to the best- and I'd suggest that you don't eat sushi at the best places in one of the largest cities in the US on the coasts or you'll understand what I mean. It's all a point of reference.

HMACMTp0F3pFAD3bMJbLyg.text: Very picky with sushi but this place is definitely worth dining in with great company! Too bad we missed happy hour.. Look forward to their happy hour next time!

sGiX5PVrHNdj0hD_6GiYQQ.text: good sushi, they don t have a liquor license yet , but excellent fish.  we had big eye tuna sashimi, salmon toro, a spicy roll and yellowtail sushi.  all were very fresh.  i will be back as soon as they have sake.

sF9f2km2_6yASA_4_8e3Lg.text: Finally got to try this place after 48 years of passing by it And it did not disappoint at all! The ambience of the place was very bold. I loved the blue painted walls and all their accent pieces and the lighting. It's such a cool spot. Food? Amazing! My friend got the Kitana rolls and you can tell by the taste that they really put so much thought in how they wanted it to taste. It has a very high quality taste to it. I ordered their Philly rolls which is made with smoked salmon, cream cheese, avocado and cucumber. I loved how the flavors just came together and it just melts in your mouth. The smoky flavor of the salmon is just right, nothing too overpowering so it could give way to the avocado and cream cheese flavors of the rolls. We also tried their Spicy edamame. The spicyness was about right. Just a little sting but nothing too crazy. And for the price of just $6, the serving was plentiful. Good for at least 2-3 people. The people were amazing too! They looked all happy and friendly and the vibe is just amazing even if there weren't alot of people earlier. I won't be too surprised if this place starts popping in the next 3-6 months.

z0VOJaOGOhPpX9SHLWLbBQ.text: Had lunch here today. Awesome. The rolls are delicious here. The sushi chef here really is magic when it comes to fish. I bet they miss him At Sushi J.

_niKYEjKfQkmW6rqsZg-_g.text: Overview: first and last time.   Food: we came during happy hour. Reasonable prices. The sushi on happy hour menu is comparable to prepackaged sushi. Sushi rice isn't soft. More hard texture like slightly uncooked rice. Happy hour quality I guess. I love toro tuna so we ordered the hand rolls-specialty menu. Sushi chef served us the happy hour sushi, them stopped to watch tv behind him. He forgot the hand rolls. He then asked if we wanted to order anymore sushi so we had to remind him we were still waiting for the remaining order. The result was also disappointing. The tuna they provided was not toro. It was not fatty, melt in your mouth, tuna. It was like ahi, raw tuna. I do not recommend it.   Service: so they provided a menu, when we got the bill, it was higher. Apparently we somehow got last year's happy hour pricing, informed them kindly. They apologize and took it off but said just "letting you know that's not the right price". Well, that was provided, it wasn't our fault as the customer that they provided the wrong menu. Overall service was so so.   Environment: newer look. Newer restaurant.   Parking: private and spacious.   Overall.. it's cheap low quality sushi. I recommend going up a little north to Hiro where you get high quality service AND quality food.

QpPogRDXwksSDqDo0TN5qA.text: Have to go with 5 stars considering this sushi joint offers the freshest cuts and super service!  The new location is bright and convenient. Portions are generous and did I mention how fresh the sushi is?  Joe and I found our AZ sushi spot!

Very cool that they comped us for our trouble.  This post is more about how bad Ubereats really.  The food is money at this place

-K83w0kMdT6gzePtxD6jdw.text: We frequent Hiro, Kodo, Harumi... This place is not even in the same ballpark. It's like going from a prime filet to a McDonald's hamburger.  We go on a Thursday around 5pm. We were the only people there. Waitress was friendly. We tell her to just give us a "feed me". She looks confused, and asked how many pieces, and we said we would just play it by ear and see how we feel. This is what we do at every sushi restaurant we go to. She said she would just put us down for the chef special, and we say OK.  About 20 minutes passes... The sushi chef who was there when we walked in had disappeared to the back before we placed our order. We thought maybe they were making our sushi in the back? Finally he comes out, and he confirms our order, and we say yes. He then STARTED to make our food.   Another 20 minutes passes... Finally our food arrives. We get 5 pieces. Regular tuna, salmon belly, mackerel, yellowtail, and one more that I can't remember. These were BASIC pieces of fish. Dry, not juicy, not flavorful, just thin dry pieces. The toppings were creative, I will give them that. But putting lipstick on a pig doesn't change anything.  We get the bill... It was over $100 with tip! Our 5 pieces were $25?! So basically that's $5 per piece. So for 2 order of tuna nigiri, was $10?! That is the most insane thing I have ever heard. One, the sushi was NOT anything speciak. Two, even if it were delicious, it's overpriced for regular tuna... Not bluefin, not Toro, regular old tuna. Three, it was 5pm... I can go to any other sushi restaurant in Scottsdale and get 2 pieces of tuna for way less at happy hour! And it would have tasted better! Two beers, at $7 a piece, what kind of happy hour is that? Also, their CO2 was not working so they only had bottled!   By the time we ate and paid, we had missed our movie. So much for a date night! We came here because of an awesome pic on Facebook, and I assure you that what we got was nothing like this. Literally the only positive was a friendly server... But waiting a ridiculously long time in an EMPTY restaurant for mediocre, overpriced sushi during happy hour... We will keep going to Hiro and get high quality food, double the pieces, for the same price! No wonder this place is on Groupon... You've got a lot of stuff to work out, guys!

H-AjoqPBC9qHFHMo8Y5-nw.text: Horrible experience. The waitress/manager niki was very rude from the beginning. Our order was messed up a few times, Appetizer potstickers came out not cooked right and cold in the center and hard. Noodles came out wrong and we tried to just keep it to not waste food but the noodles had no taste at all and never came with the vegetables that the waitress said it came with so we had to send it back. We never got asked or offered if we wanted refills for our drinks. When we asked for our bill she got upset that we asked to split it into 3 bills which I have never experienced that being an issue in any other restaurant. She brought our split bills and gave them out with an attitude and even slammed one on the table. We told her how her service was and she did not apologize at all but made excuses that her ONLY other table of 13 people did not complain( they didnt complain cause she gave all her attention to them). If you cant work more than one table then being a waitress might not be for you. We asked to speak to the owner scott and he was not much help also, he didnt even introduce himself. We had to ask over 3 times for boxes and he also didnt apologize until we mentioned that niki couldnt even say sorry. Very rude and disrespectful establishment. The food was okay, not worth going back with that negative environment. We live in the neighborhood and have been here and decided to bring my family thats in town visiting to eat and sucks to have such a horrible experience. Definitely wont be back there again.

xDi0XrY7z0nVW5cfHsRuFg.text: We came on chrismas day and it was horrible. The service was terrible, the place was at 50% capacity but the the service was so slow. They brought out the food after 30 min. When we said we ordered soup for appetizers the waitress indicated the soups are hand made one bowl at the time and will come out when ready...seriously??? Hot and sour soup and dumpling soup?? Really??? The portions were a good size but the food had no taste. The pad thai was very sour, I love thai food and this did not resemble pad thai. But by far the worse was the hot and sour soup. The smell was nausiating I dared to taste it and the taste matched the smell. I returned the soup, which I never do, but honestly couldn't stand the smell. I have never given a one star but honestly this is the worst Asian food I have ever had.

VAriU6ZZnkQuw5vrTSDp3Q.text: Went to J's new place yesterday for dinner to celebrate my daughter's birthday.     I had the Korean bowl and my daughter had the chirashi.   I didn't know what was meant by "korean bowl" other than the description, but I must admit, I was pleasantly surprised.   It has the sushi rice at the bottom, flavored with rice vinegar, sugar, etc.   The rice was topped with an assortment of leaf lettuce and other mixed greens, sashimi -- is that rice threads? -- seaweed, etc.  It was accompanied by a very tasty sauce that I used to dip the sashimi and lettuce.   It just needed a tiny bit since the sauce was "strong."   I liked it.   I would say it is a "light" and healthy meal.  My daughter said her chirashi was good.   It almost looked the same as my bowl.      J's new place is very light, airy and open.  It has a sushi bar and a seating area in the front and along the side.  Very welcoming.  The server Rachel was very friendly and efficient.  There is a patio as well for those cool days.  I would go again to try other items on the menu.

cclw-3KoaJWua0Vd91Ha-w.text: I checked out J's Kaiyo sushi recently on a Friday evening with a few friends. Our experience overall was a bit disappointing to say the least. Mind you, we drove about 20 miles to dine here specifically as we were all in a sushi mood that night & this place was highly rated. The restaurant is nicely decorated and has a cool vibe yet on a Friday night around 7ish it wasn't really busy (maybe 4 tables besides us?). We placed our order for a few appetizers and about 15 min later it still wasn't on the table. We had ordered the Shishito peppers and garlic edamame. I asked our server and he went to check with the kitchen then came back and said "just a few more minutes". OK, np we were starving but patient. 10 minutes later we still didn't have our appetizers but they did eventually come out (once we received our entrees). This was not OK but we didn't say anything to our server as I said, we were really hungry. The food looked amazing but the shishito peppers were exceptionally salty, the garlic edamame was just eh because the garlic got burned (you know when you can taste that burnt garlic flavor). The Vegetable Udon was very spicy, too spicy for a few of us at the table. My roll (can't remember the name) was pretty good but my veggie roll was just ok, very small. Our server wasn't as attentive as I expected, waiting around for water after eating spicy food is not ok. I get it, especially on a busy weekend but if it's not that busy I feel attentiveness is important. Overall, for the price I don't feel we received a good value for the experience. Will we be back? Not likely. Too many other sushi restaurants to try closer to home.

nNPNJS4k-4hPkXY62jvcfg.text: This is a nice little spot not far off the Scottsdale Greenbelt. We stopped in for a quick bite during our afternoon ride and found the patio was perfect. The lettuce wraps are tasty in particular and we ordered the Vegas roll and the spicy salmon roll.

-cvSvoBVZHltntZmfDNdPg.text: Having lived in Cabo for years I thought there was no way I'd find sushi that was incredible and fresh.... then I found Kaiyo. 5kW_cd1GG__SpQ5bdJlmAw.text: My boyfriend and I went to J's Kaiyo Sushi and Bar and can not say enough about quality, service and ambience at this Scottsdale restaurant. It rivals the best sushi restaurants in LA and Japan!! Very fresh seafood and creative dishes.  The owner greeted us with a positive happy hello which is rare in sometimes "snobby" Scottsdale.  Music playing in background was refreshing(not techno!). Our server(kaylee?) was very knowledgeable with menu items and gave excellent recommendations.  She was also very friendly and made our date night a 5 star experience!  DO NOT confuse J's Kaiyo with the other sushi restaurant next door also with a "J"!!!  J's Kaiyo is the only sushi restaurant to go to in Scottsdale!!!  We will be back!

WoRAczIT_MNJMHJtVnDcTw.text: I like restaurants with passion and not part of larger chains. I like the feel you get, where it can be like your favorite episode of Cheers where everyone knows your name, if you go there long enough. I like finding gems in old town Scottsdale just like this place. Good food, good environments and a present owner. I went the first time with my husband just to check out a new local spot, and it didn't disappoint. Great food, great HH, friendly owner, nice staff. I returned today for a 2nd time, after finding mixed reviews and them not making sense. I like to see for myself and make my own opinions so I returned in need of a good glass of wine and some good food.  I sat at the bar, and the owner was very friendly and attentive. And not in a "I'm supposed to way," but in a genuine way. And aren't genuine people tough to come across these days? I ordered a glass of Kung Fu girl wine, my sister bought me a bottle one time. I kickbox and she thought it was funny. It's also not a bad Riesling. The owner asked if I had had it before, not many order it but it is so delicious, so I told him the story.  I settled on the black pepper beef, and it came out promptly and sizzling hot. The owner even mentioned that they have brown rice now so in my working out self if i wanted that, it's been added to the menu. WOW, so he listened to me too and my story. Sometimes you never know. LOL. The food was wonderful and hit the spot. The owner sent me home with a magnet, in case I need delivery and a card for some edamame. I overheard him talking to another table about Sunday brunch and free wing tuesdays with the purchase of a beverage. I like this place, I like the owner and his staff. This business is tough and I like supporting local. I think I may take my husband to brunch this Sunday, sake bombs and good food sounds delicious.

-0NuwV5P3I8ocQhDdG_wyg.text: When it opened, it was actually good.  Fresh fish.  Now we've been back quite a few times since and it just keeps going downhill.  Last time we went they were out of 80% of what we ordered so we just left.  This time, will be the last time.   Rice is wet and undercooked.  Tempura was wet and soggy.   Sushi was room temperature.   We noticed that the main sushi chef isn't there anymore...and it's noticeable.   Good service but not great food.

kRZW-U8jXhs5nUiB13tbXQ.text: For the value during happy hour, I give this place five stars. We had the edamame, seaweed salad, yellowtail nigiri, salmon nigiri, and crab avocado from the happy hour menu. All were great quality and I was especially impressed by the generously sized cuts of fresh fish.   We also had the chicken thighs off the regular menu and give them a big thumbs up.   Service was quick and friendly. It wasn't busy when we first arrived, but was starting to pick up as it got later.   They have a small outdoor patio for nice nights.   Happy hour is currently 430-630pm.

kV-omhg97up8R1d_-EzS-Q.text: I'm a very picky Chinese foodie! I've had the best, and have been searching since I moved to Scottsdale. We kept saying we've got to eat here, it's so close to home and I'm at that Sprouts mall often. Finally we had lunch and it was fantastic! I had the hot and sour soup which was delicious. I had the orange chicken which was delicious as well! I've been back a bunch and I really like it. They have a lunch special which changes daily for $7.00!  Saturday I had the Kung pao chicken which was fantastic! It's a nice place, great manager and wait staff, immaculate. I highly recommend!

jdx9dhMLHeHR_JnTubZimw.text: If you think you are about to eat a normal Chinese takeout meal be prepared to be unbelievably disappointed.  Not sure how this place could have 151 4+ star reviews.   Ordered the crab Rangoons/wontons. They were neatly arranged in the tray but then I looked at the sauce and was dismayed to find some raspberry concoction. Sadly, the wontons were not cooked well and were chewy, probably because they tried to shape it like a tortellini.  Fried rice has a sunny side up fried egg with black sesame seeds? Never have seen that before. I will say the way the shrimp was wok seared gave it a good flavor.   Walnut shrimp dish, not very common to find this dish in town done well. In this case, it may be the worst interpretation I have had the displeasure of trying. No tempura, just a wok seared shrimp. Candied walnuts are normally on the dish, these were some wok seared walnuts.  I have no idea what kind of runny brown sauce was in the tray but it was not mayo and karo.   Lastly we had the orange beef. Cubed beef was the start of this poorly executed dish. I did taste the orange in the dish but only after gnawing on the beef jerky like cubes of beef.   Unless you really want to subject yourself to a poor interpretation of whatever panasian dining is, skip this restaurant.  Maybe their Japanese options are better but I cannot opine on the subject as I only attempted their version of Chinese. I know the restaurant industry is tough and making poorly executed dishes as the ones here is only going to make it a tougher go for this establishment for the future. Dear Chef, at a minimum, please taste the dishes you are putting out for consumption; if panasian means no salt, you nailed it.

0uLRY7Q1fQbcL50rseb2aQ.text: With all the great press, we came with high expectations. Love the decor, staff was friendly enough, but the food was well...  - Cucumber salad- was beautiful, but awkward to eat with large, irregularly shaped chunks. The miso dressing was tasty when you got some, but overall the dish tasted flat. Maybe cut the cukes smaller and marinate a bit longer? - Edamame- good size bowl, nice and steamy, but a bit too much salt even more me (and that's saying somethin') - Avocado stuffed with crab- this seems to be the darling of food critics, but I just didn't dig it. Lovely presentation, but the crab in the middle tasted more like tuna. I avoided the mango (allergy), but B said it was too sweet; better with a dip in soy. - Loli roll- sans rice and nori was fresh tasty, but ours didn't look like the lollipops I saw on earlier Yelp pics.  - King of Persia- this was the best of the three we tried, loved the tempura green onion - Citrus salmon- had potential, but it had a fishy taste that is never good when eating sushi  - Octopus- this was amazing!! One of the best octo-dishes I've ever had. Perfectly cooked, served over a yummy squash puree. If everything we ordered tasted this good, I'd be 5 star-ing.   Would return for the octopus, and to try a few more of their small plates and salad, but not a sushi destination.

It was mixed well and the chicken was great!   Customer service: Scott was walking around the restaurant and greeted us while we were sitting and eating. Very friendly guy and will make sure your visit is up to standards. We had a messup on our check and he fixed it right away for us and even have us some free spring rolls prior to that. Thanks for having a great variety in the menu and providing us all with a local sushi restaurant.

The classic sushi was perfect and the specialty sushi was fun and tasty.  We were surprised to see they also had Chinese food so we tried their wok and roll chicken and were pleasantly happy with it.  The atmosphere and music was great and had my wife and i singing along as great song after great song came on.   We will be back!

kI53KYy67P_mpmPts3I7cQ.text: Great place!  I've only had take out but the restaurant is really fun inside.  It's a new place & they redid the entire inside.   We had the dumpling soup & chicken chow mein & both were good.   Give it a try!  They also have a patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

XYtd7qQkdX33Pa9_GRGxCA.text: First time... accommodating staff, savory dishes, generous portions and comfortable surroundings.   Great experience.   Ample TVs with whatever sport you want and NFL early Sunday with breakfast.

iE6RXXzBtyGt5_liuqD11A.text: I was in wok and roll pregame, my softball team has decided that is our new go-to place before we hit the field at chaparral. Our server was Sandy she was pleasant and personable, she was quick, and she anticipated our needs. we have been there several times now, and have decided this should probably be our pregame ritual. The food is delicious and presented beautifully, the sushi is fresh and beautifully presented, and we always leave with a smile on our face.

h6Q1eV9Z_P8f3YefvEGWPA.text: If you haven't been here yet, you have to stop by.   I love it so much I went twice in one week!  First of all, the happy hour prices are great. My first time in I ordered 2 spicy salmon hand rolls and a 2pc yellowtail nigiri for myself, and it was only $11 on happy hour before tip. I went in a second time with my boyfriend and we ordered 5 hand rolls, 4pc nigiri (salmon and yellowtail), and a mixed seafood poke bowl, all for about $35(?).   The fish is fresh and delicious. The first time I had the spicy salmon hand rolls, the fish was cut in larger chunks and absolutely melted in your mouth. I like that consistency a lot more than the super-chopped spicy salmon mix that most sushi restaurants serve.   We also really liked the ambiance. The servers were so friendly and Mallory - the sushi chef - was very kind and answered all of our questions.   I can't wait to come back and explore the rest of the menu! I have my eye on a certain specialty roll...  Edited to mention that the prices above are before tip.

9ni0qQZXiR_kJ19w1E7JiQ.text: It is unfortunate that new ownership/management from Sushi J have taken the quality way down. For the price they charge, I would expect a higher quality product. Unfortunately, I could have walked across the parking lot to Sprouts and got mediocre sushi for less money.  Huge disappointment in quality. The one positive aspect is the waitress, she was very courteous and provided great service. I will find another spot for this area to entertain clients.

photos.caption: Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Rainbow roll minus the rainbow. Very little fish provided and what was there seemed old.

R7DcCFB4JgpD0mP8reHJ9A.text: We read that Sushi J's Chef had moved to this new Place. Gave it a try, First there is no Beer , the Las Vegas Roll was awful. It taste like New B's made the sushi. Not the great taste from the original Sushi J'S we had tasted.

qEx3hrkV4ke8Ng1yRSL4Tw.text: Amazingly fresh sushi! The service was so good. We were there last night for dinner. Affordable and the ambiance was modern and chic!

Pl93Y4R0aaD7KlatWD8JiA.text: So happy they finally opened up! I don't go anywhere else for sushi and had been waiting for J's new venture to open. I loved the original Sushi J and am so glad he has his great staff with him!   I was still able to get my regular favorite rolls and will be back as often as possible. The service and decor is amazing as well as the fresh delicious sushi!

xzFj9r-M2NCKsTSk0AY-qA.text: I will have to say by far this is the best sushi place i have eaten in a while. I grew up in the west coast and traveled east but to get a very fresh fish in arizona i am impressed~! The name lives up to the chefs who make art out of sushi and when they come alive its an explosion of flavors in every bite. I also like the way you can ask for a chefs special touch on all your eats and make special each meal. The atmosphere is beautiful and price is good you cant go wrong with "j's kaiyo" its the best place to get your fresh sushi in the north downtown scottsdale. It beats the joint across the parking lot by far must try it out.

a5oC8iGQWyhr1z7OhAXzOg.text: As a foodie, there's nothing else that makes me happy than discovering a great sushi place.  Went in on a Friday night and it wasn't busy. Our server was absolutely wonderful, and so was our sushi chef who ensured that we had a great dinner. For appetizers, I had a seaweed salad. It was good. I did wish that it came in a bigger serving. I also had the soft shell crab which I loved. It was cooked perfectly, and surprisingly had a lot of crab meat in it. The pork gyoza was good, nothing special but gyoza is gyoza. We had some of the salmon toro and our chef gave us a free pieces so we can pick between raw or torched salmon toro. Both tasted amazing. I had the King of Persia roll. It was okay; I thought it was very spicy. The spicy salmon roll was delicious. My boyfriend was not a fan of the sushi rice - he thought it was too cold which I agreed. We usually prefer room temperature sushi rice. Between us, we spent about $100. It was pricy but for a sushi place in old town, kind of expected. I will definitely be back when they open for happy hour!

udSsLfF8R_bRlbzu8Z53Ig.text: Phenomenal sushi. The price point is perfect. Ask for what is off the menu for the day. The spicy wings are sauteed in Serrano peppers. The fish melts in your mouth. Our favorites are the big eye tuna sashimi and hamachi toro roll. Atmosphere is relaxing and staff are great.

guHebUAvZEUZvPn4auvNuA.text: J and Taek never disappoint me! Hands down the beat sushi restaurant in Arizona. I still do not know how he can consistently put out such high quality dishes at such a fair price. One would never imagine fish being this fresh in Arizona, but this is the real deal. My wife and I are from the Seattle and J's is just as fresh if not better. This is a real family owned establishment that never sacrifices quality and really cares about their cliental. If you are serious about eating some real good food, stop on by and get your grub on!

2S1VrZGYVYK_uGXbD2hpIw.text: Walking in, the vibe and ambiance of the restuarant with plenty of open space and soft colors of ocean blues create the vibe of an oceanic sushi oasis with a delicious menu choices super fresh and flavorful to the palette. J is amazing! He continues to get great quality fish and ingredients! My fav? Always the yellowtail and unique rolls named Dynamite.. Marilyn Monroll... I could go on and on with the coolness and creativeness of this place but you need to just try it for yourself! Best new little sushi gem in Scottsdale is now my ONLY sushi joint in town!

zilduRqALUS5o5ql7Zm95w.text: Sushi rolls are unique and delicious. Had the spicy Korean sashimi bowl and it comes with rice. Very authentic, healthy and the right balance of protein and carb.

Y23mQuUd7u8RM_1MYyahpw.text: It was my first visit as I am from out of town but travel here frequently. I ordered two rolls and they were both prepared perfectly.  The service was spot on and the taste of the food did not disappoint.

BEV175qFlgCcYeVfVfGD6A.text: Service was amazing. Sushi was fresh and unique. Best spot I've been to in scottsdale.

jM9vLRxfbhmwlSU5OF2p3Q.text: This is our new favorite sushi place in Scottsdale! I've been a couple times with my boyfriend and every time the sushi chef makes us a perfect personalized roll with chicken (not in the menu) and I love it. Great customer service, very accommodating. A must try!

78fa228YOvkENQAvqtQODg.text: I was looking for a new sushi spot and came upon this place.  The sushi was fresh and authentic.  The King of Persia roll was one of the best rolls I've had.  I will have to come back to try some more rolls and sashimi.  Service was pretty decent for a place that had been opened for only a few weeks.

Zw18mCWr60YXNlD5s7zZGw.text: This place is awesome!  Delicious sushi, awesome service, and close to home.  Cannot beat it!!

q88M3UL3MYYkgg3FghDiZw.text: This is a great casual sushi restaurant to get some sushi in old town Scottsdale. I hate it when I go to a sushi restaurant and they slice the fish too thin or give you fish that is not his rash. This is not a problem at this place. The service is pretty good and it is not super upscale but the prices are very reasonable and the sushi is fantastic. The happy hour is awesome.

mudDnODDUG5q8AgphhJJ1Q.text: Amazing sushi quality. I am very happy with the freshness of the fish. Also amazing service by Mallory. 10/10 on service,atmosphere and sushi quality.

dD3jjsQ5kz5k9eHdQhe4UQ.text: The sushi was good although it's not the best I've had. The waitress and the stuff were very friendly and helpful when we asked about specifics on the menu. It has relatively good pricing as well.

-wUdFh7sfSnIOrSkm3qudg.text: Really great sushi and love the atmosphere. Decorated much nicer then most sushi places you find. My only complaint is that they are closed on Sundays!

JC-yxpoM_YW6_2BTz4h5TQ.text: Server was very attentive, atmosphere & decor was modern & upbeat, food only so-so. Don't like when lettuce in salad is limp or has spoiled edges. Tuna chunks in Sashimi salad were small, grayish, dry, tasteless. Monster roll was big-even hubby couldn't get one piece in his mouth, consequently was too messy as it broke apart & seaweed made it hard to bite gracefully. Complimentary miso soup was indeed very nice, though.

MrVpn9ZAVrtojoyaV8bXKg.text: Great service. Good food. Good prices. We were handled with care and love by the manager and our server Cynthia. Thank you

vYkhapoxWOIwdWMzB64yJA.text: Fantastic! Visited this tasty sushi place again and they definitely have tightened up their service and have fixed all of the minor issues I witnessed with my first visit when they were just getting up and running. They still do not have a liqueur license but should have one before the end of the year making this a hot spot for the old town dining scene.

ZzMr868By36vlqc2BdVGiA.text: Excellent new sushi slot in Snotsdale. This sushi place is a nice little secret and not located in the center of the hustle of Old town Scottsdale, but is easily accessible due to its proximity to it. Wonderful service and candor with Rachel who is A+++ as our server last night, and made my visiting friend feel like he was eating grade A sushi in SF! We were not terribly disappointed for the lack of the liquor license as OHSO and other fine drinking establishments are not too far away.

VRPiEeSEk8VfreAiMjl69Q.text: Best fish in AZ. Todd turns out phenominal dish after dish. The people and service are great! No need to go anywhere else! Chef Jason on the grill in the back will undoubtedly impress!

Z1rwT73roSdymQ5QM_z3dA.text: I like this place because they make some innovative rolls that are really interesting  along with the standard rolls that you expect. I have tried the "low carb" wrapped in either rice paper or cucumber and they are delicious. Staff friendly and unobtrusive.

crRhVjtUcrF8QAuh3p4-4g.text: Great customer service, but doesn't make up for the bad sushi. Our fries roll was so drenched in oil I couldn't eat it. The sea weed was chewy and one of our rolls came out minutes after we were done eating the other 3. I must say the Manager even opened up the door for us and sat us down (so nice) but I'm a foodie.

s2gC9EQzPuKwo5U3Nx6gFg.text: Just had our second visit to J's Kaiyo sushi bar and it was wonderful. Great atmosphere, great food, the staff is amazing. Kudos to Trevor the bartender he was really helpful. Give this spot a try!

iy_BN4I2vewB_4GWolafIw.text: New place in old town. Pretty picky about sushi, and this place was amazing!  Will definitely be back.

ZCO8HYjl-Gg6KDRWAFJ7GQ.text: King of Prussia, Marilyn Monroll, and the calamari / jalapeno App were awesome!  Great spot for Saturday night date night :-)

j2GUO3F00LP9fjISVn7tlA.text: Horrible service and experience. We got sat quickly, but then were ignored as tables around us got sat and even got their orders taken. We weren't even brought water! The services and management looked directly at us multiple times and put conversations with friends at the bar and multiple other distractions above us. Super disappointing and I am questioning there professionalism and ethics which is frightening at a place that serves sushi.

x6o3Y7w_5Qypl9VIRzjerw.text: Ridiculously good clean sushi coupled with fresh grooves.  Todd slices nice pieces of sashimi and creates daily phat rolls.  Check it out...you won't be disappointed.

NNe7vQYF36YGYxYIVkPbGw.text: It's a sushi restaurant in a strip mall that has been many other iterations of sushi restaurants in its life, but they have happy hour til 7 on Saturday with some delicious choices.

OiCDuMfzthshyRPcWBMDug.text: My new favorite place for sushi in Scottsdale. Fresh, wild caught selections in a nice ambience. Ask for the chef's choice roll. Never disappoints.

1nQxCpeCaPBVS2zebvkHeA.text: Great and tasty low carb sushi options! Ordered the Marilyn Monroe, King of Prussia, salmon sashimi and the calamari and everything was delicious! Highly recommended!

vSuWu-Zv63-99l2U9zUlpg.text: I enjoyed the appetizers they sold, but didn't care for the incessant disparagement of their rival restaurant that happens to be across parking lot. Customers may come here because they may confuse it with that very place and when they tell you 'that place is out of business' or 'they are closing'. They should instead compete on the quality of their food instead of spreading rumors. Go here and Sushi J and judge for yourself who is better.

EhRkZ3u1euWWrs756UMiGg.text: The absolute best!!!!! The new location is absolutely beautiful the service is outstanding and the food is incredible I honestly could eat here every day but once a week will do!

WUMzloG9wEfTtdaPJXbpYQ.text: Very good sushi. We came here after a very disappointing and inedible experience at Akita sushi. Excellent sushi, great gyoza, and a wonderful salad with yummy ginger dressing. I will return when I'm in Phoenix.

FHFtxnz54vqnOg54bamzbg.text: Not often you see a five star on yelp. This one lived up to the hype. We ordered the Geisha Roll, Scottsdale Roll, Marilyn Roll, and Katana Roll. They all had their own unique taste and were delicious. Atmosphere was casual, bright and relaxed. I will be back!

rM269A8kgCoSC1dxdVAL5g.text: Great food, beautiful setting, quick service. Edson was an amazing waiter! Very attentive and kind. Definitely will come back :)

vTrIQokm4CsmuBvxooU8uQ.text: I Just returned from Tokyo and I was looking for a great sushi restaurant. Luckily for me I found Kaiyo Sushi! The sushi is amazing and the service is excellent! I highly recommend Kaiyo if you're looking for fresh quality sushi and a great dinning experience!

bnje2iX8f8TSHNS5XL3m-w.text: After searching far and wide we have finally found our new favorite sushi spot in valley!! This place is amazing, everything we ordered was perfectly executed and delicious! We celebrated my Husbands Birthday with these fine folks last Saturday and they took such incredible care of our party. Thanks again, we shall be visiting you again soon!!

rx7yScQ7zcLtfaTA_MNuWw.text: This used to be my go to. Sadly, it has progressively went downhill since under the new ownership. I've given them several times to redeem themselves yet service is consistently terrible. Yes, terrible.  Please don't respond and make excuses.

zOm-69XMQH25piyYmmUmPw.text: Amazing dining experience - food and service were absolutely fantastic! We had the $15 lunch special with chicken fried rice and two spicy tuna rolls and the dumpling soup and California roll. They even brought me a cup of crispy rice noodles when I mentioned that I love those.   The owner came up to us to greet us and show us around the restaurant. It's truly a "wok 'n roll" experience with thoughtfully placed song lyrics on the wall and various pieces of art that fit the rock theme.  Highly recommend this place! We'll definitely be back next time we are in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Clockwise from top left: chicken fried rice, two spicy tuna roles ($15 for all three items), CA roll, and bowl of dumpling soup.
Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing bowl of dumpling soup
Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Extra order of crispy rice noodles - yum

l636jAQQUJR9FV4kz8nAEQ.text: My wife craving noodles last night, specifically chow main so we went on yelp to see highly rated places near us. When we got to the restaurant  we realized we had been to this place before when it had a different name. Our server was named Britney and she was very friendly and timly refilled my glass multiple times. I got the Dan Dan noodles which were tasty and bit spicy, my wife got the chicken chow mien, both were served in large bowls, we both had leftovers. Great value for $9 a bowl, we will be back.

CkPcLriPu4VykRcdLYbb3A.text: The owner, Scott is a rude man,,, he tries to be nice in a very sarcastic way where you know he's hinting something rude. Food was okay... if you like ALOT of rice and very little chicken... and somehow at the end 2 8$ meals = 30$ ???? Um nope never going back again. Horrible place and horrible customer service. Only good thing about it is how clean inside is.

Ftze7sKBe9bkqvZIuUpLpA.text: Came for the 7-course Groupon on a Saturday around 3pm. My girlfriend and I had been set on sushi for a late lunch. Part of the Groupon was a sake, which we ordered immediately. After Brenda went to get our drink and put in our edamame, the owner came out to tell us that their sushi chef didn't come in until 4. So we would have to wait if we wanted sushi. We were going to a movie in Tempe at 5. Not sure what to do because we felt rude leaving, the owner said he would comp our sake, and we decided we would to split a vegetable pad thai.   It was huge/delicious and our server Brenda was such a sweetheart. Great service all around and we definitely felt the hospitality was real. We will be back, and not just bc we have a groupon to use.

D1D0KMEOHYAJXrHiFUepGg.text: Updated review: This used to be J's Kaiyo, which was an incredible new addition to this neighborhood and worthy of 5 stars. It was then purchased by a new owner who changed everything including the menu but managed to keep J's Kaiyo's Yelp account ratings, which is why I felt the need to update this review.   I went there before the name change and was unaware of the new ownership, but could tell something was off. The roll I always ordered didn't taste as fresh and there was an obnoxious man in a Tommy Bahama shirt managing the place. It's now completely different and no longer has the magic of J's Kaiyo. Thank goodness Sushi J stayed open.  I decided to stop in for a quick lunch and ordered the pad thai option with chicken... Meh. It tastes like one of those "pad thai" bowls or packets you can get in the Asian food aisle at Fry's. The only saving grace was the one server/hostess who was busting her hump during the lunch rush. (There were maybe 5 tables occupied but plenty of people coming and going with takeout orders.) She is the only reason I gave this place 2 stars.

bkDJs_uAcLv9S57SlCe6yQ.text: Service was amazing! Sat at the bar with a girlfriend, was able to relax and enjoy ourselves without worrying if our server forgot about us-she was very attentive and friendly!  Ordered sushi & nigiri off the happy hour menu and the prices were definitely reasonable. Will be back to try the asian plates and more of their rolls.

BwEHPhlEuO6BlqI2Pd8xMA.text: Walked here for dinner last week. Staff was efficient and friendly. The food was fantastic!  It will definitely be added to the rotation when we crave sushi.

af1hXbDYVzulCKLxUNnFlw.text: While looking for places to grab a bite to eat with some friends we stumbled across wok 'n roll! Walking in, we were greeted with a smile from the host and sat inside at a booth. The place was clean, and had cute decor and furniture. They have a nice patio area and is also dog friendly! Prices were very reasonable -- especially for scottsdale and the food was tasty. We got vegetable spring rolls, crave-able crab puffs, fried rice, orange chicken and a few sushi rolls.  Service was prompt, glasses were always full and the owner even came around to say good evening and chat! We will definitely come back again. They are open for lunch as well and have great happy hour prices!

MMrAFPlfoioWZOAUN_qZNw.text: I took my social group called Upscale Trendy circle there on Thursday evening for Happy Hour.  I am so glad I did the service was amazing and food was to die for.  The Spicy Salmon Rolls and the wings so hot my goodness it was so yummy.   The Best I ever had!  My group everyone enjoy all the food and drinks!  Scott the Owner very nice and talked to everyone.  Nicky the Manager did outstanding job with my group that are fun and crazy at the same time.    We will back for sure very soon!  Thank-u very much for your outstanding service at your bar.   Cheers,  DJ Roy

hV9bRz80nqsESBUcKUUNtQ.text: Scott is rocking in Scottsdale.  Great place!!!!  Excellent menu.  Perfect local spot.

HlhUbjang3eZ0MEJC7Ly2Q.text: First time here tonight. Photo is Mongolian Beef, and I had a FANTASTIC drink called "smokin' in the boys room" which I'd describe as an Asian inspired Manhattan. Scott, the owner, will bend over backwards to make you happy! Great happy hour 3-6 with app and drink specials. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

i-rzUShdOTKyUaNS0OPvpg.text: Really enjoyed my meal at J Kaiyo's. The food and service was excellent. We ordered a bunch of appetizers off the happy hour menu (on a Saturday) which was enough for 3 of us. The avocado and crab rolls were bomb! The spicy salmon and tuna rolls were 2 of the best I have had. Highly recommended

ak4hvUzNddad7al6RxQkJA.text: Fresh fresh Chinese food that is locally owned. Prices are better that P.F. changes and taste even better. Their sushi chef is one of a kind. Can't wait to go back and say hi to the witty bartender named Brenda.

mMu2waob1DIv2YFXgjCJKw.text: We accidentally stumbled across this place and decided to go in and try it. I'm so happy that we did. The food was delicious. We ordered both sushi and Chinese food and both were yummy. The sushi was so fresh. We didn't make it in time for happy hour but they have happy hour from 11-7 everyday. We will definitely be going back.

xagm7HatAhEKXDtDQshNXA.text: Scott the new owner is an absolute gem! If you ever get the chance to speak to him, I highly recommend it. His staff is absolutely amazing - and it says a lot about a leader when they are grateful for their staff and skills. Miguel was my sushi chef, and he's incredibly knowledgeable! He pays attention to detail, quality, and gas high standards for his art. Although I didn't catch the host/waitress' name she was warm, friendly, and so helpful.   I'll absolutely be coming back here again! Thanks to everyone

7qEXudX_o-8wFLiJkEqYiA.text: I stopped in here for a solo lunch because I happened to have some time to burn in the area. The service was impeccable! They were all SO friendly and attentive. My water was never less than half full. I got some nigiri sushi and it was delicious. Very fresh, perfect ratio of fish and rice, and a great cut of fish. I also tried a special roll, which I thought was a little too saucy and overpowered the fish. I considered 4 stars for this but, to be fair, I'm the one who ordered a special roll. Next time, I'll stick with the fresh nigiri sushi and basic maki rolls. 5 stars for those and the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Red dragon special roll

jvQiwwAqYY3n3L2T_N3lzg.text: Danielle was the best server ever, she really helped us out, made the best recommendations and even put glitter in my girlfriend Shirley temple, if you're looking for the best sushi/Chinese food place in Scottsdale; I highly recommend this place (:

-BriM0SaD5EUwN0iaRIgEw.text: Great experience, do not listen to the bad reviews. We got a Groupon randomly and went on a Saturday. We really enjoyed our experience. The food (especially the salmon sashimi and house made crab puffs, fried rice too) were all really good. The happy hour is 11-7 every day. Good appetizers, portions, and a fun vibe. The owner was super friendly, and the server was awesome. I will definitely bring my friends and coworkers back for happy hour. I wouldn't say it's the absolute best sushi I've ever had, but I am so glad south Scottsdale has another hip sushi place for happy hour that has Asian fusion and good sushi. The decor is cool too, a rock and roll beachy vibe.

BT_YcJlv1D5rCQfv9nLgRg.text: As a first time guest, we came to Wok N Roll on Christmas Day. We were kindly greeted by the owner Scott. He was really friendly guy and made sure our visit was up to standards. He even let us put our food in to go when they were at full capacity and under staffed. He was worried that we might wait too long. In reality, I was expecting this at any restaurant open on Christmas. My first impression when we came in: fun decor, great variety in the menu, plenty of seating... The food was great! Mongolian beef and orange chicken. Both our dishes had tender meat, good flavor, and excellent entree to rice ratio. Highly recommend if you are looking for a bistro atmosphere that serves those classic Chinese American dishes we all love.   Merry Christmas Scott and staff!

jEUkb8jRZee1b8lAeI5TnQ.text: This is Chef Jay's- from "Sushi J" new spot! Amazing sushi as usual but now it's served out of a beautifully renovated restaurant. They brought the whole staff from the old restaurant so service is great- very attentive and it seems like they make extra effort to get to know you. We had a couple appetizers like the garlic edamame which is new to the menu. We also had the fried rice which is the absolute best. I don't know what they do to make it so good but it is BOMB. Then we had our usual sushi rolls our favorites are the king of Persia, the heatstroke, and the fire dragon. Finish everything with some green tea mochi and that's the recipe for a perfect date night!

OO71GX0cYs0rDX4-lILmsQ.text: The teenagers and I were out biking and saw that the old Arbys was up and running as our favorite food ever SUSHI!!  So the step-daughter and I came the following night. Great atmosphere inside and awesome greeter and waitress following. Pricing a lil normal to high (not great for teenagers with bottomless pits for stomachs) for sushi. Walking distance from our home major plus!

photos.caption: Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Greeters station
Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tempura Shrimp
Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Candy cane roll, yum!

LZeJ0YjhIYVdG3iPmzBhpA.text: My 4th time at Wok and Roll.  It was promoted heavily on Next-door so I wanted to support a local restaurant.  The first time I came with a friend since owner was giving a free edamame with our order.  We sat on the patio. Food was ok.  Service horrible.  The bartender, female long hair never came out to wait on us and I actually went inside a couple times to order. The place was empty.   My friend didn't want to leave much of a tip because of bad service.  I came in a couple more times and sat at bar.  Tons of waiters standing around, including owner, no customers and again no one waits on you.  The only reason I came back is the prices were decent for wine and owner comped a glass.  Tonight, a Friday night at 7pm, the restaurant was again empty.  I sat at bar 5 minutes and no one came. People, including owner standing around.  I don't get it. I told the same bartender who was running around the restaurant I wanted to order.  She started putting plates on tables instead of taking my order.  The guy next to me said she had a horrible attitude.  Owners daughter came by and I told her I wanted to order.   She on the other hand is actually the only one in the place that cares,  but I was already so irritated by the other waitress/ bartender and owner it didn't matter.  My wine went from $6.00 from last 2 visits (not happy hour) to $9.00 so unfortunately not interested in coming back for just ok food and horrible service, owners daughter excluded.  Take it for what you will but I cannot support a restaurant that doesn't understand that when you have no customers in the place, you don't drive away the ones you have by not waiting on them.  I'm sorry to say,  this place won't make it 3 more months.  Again when a Friday and Saturday night are completely empty, there is something seriously wrong.  Note:  This is a new owner and only recent reviews are for Wok and Roll. Yelp needs to take down the reviews for the previous Restaurant.

8aNa835STYYkekecvi23Gw.text: Very yummy ,  the portions are very small . We  not looking for spill over the side portions. And are not big portion eaters . But when you have to order a second dinner it might not be enough. I said to my wife tonight . Do you want to go back to work N Roll . She said it's not enough food for the $. It's very good . I'm sure I will eventually go back.

La-nzbqxyqj4fkTQ3LYu8w.text: If mediocrity was the goal, this is a five-star hit. I know there were some bumps in the road in getting this venture off the ground. With the delays, I would have expected them to have more time to reach for the stars. Unfortunately, that doesn't appear to have been the case.  When we arrived, the music was so loud, we couldn't sit in the main section of the restaurant. The servers were friendly enough, but I didn't come looking for companionship; I came in hopes of being wowed with professionalism. They fell short. Training is sorely lacking. The food showed flashes of creativity and potential, but it generally fell short of the level I had expected. It was mediocre at best.  There's still time to move it up the ladder, but there's work to be done. For me, I'll be waiting until someone tells me they've upped their game.

d2kS3kGD7bgUJWHqa9G15Q.text: Visited for our first time today and had a great lunch!  Kung Pao Shrimp was amazing!  Dumpling Soup and Chicken Fried Rice were also fantastic!  They're putting in the NFL Sunday Ticket and will have breakfast and football!  Also, server Nicki was great!  Can't wait to go back next time!

NjyVCcUDG19qpIRZJQNG4w.text: Fast, friendly service! We got a variety of entrees to share and they were all delicious! Great for families and hubby wanting to watch NFL Sunday games! Thanks Wok N Roll.

IhDFBMjhV8OuUcb7ZvhMBw.text: It was the most amazing sushi, sashimi, and rolls. Moreover, the resturant was so fancy. This restaurant is perfect place!

2wNHNnn82YyInWMx3eHMfg.text: This is my go-to sushi spot in Scottsdale! The staff is always super friendly and knowledgable about all of the items on the menu. The restaurant itself is beautiful looking on the inside making for a great experience. The fish is always fresh and the garlic edamame is my favorite!!! If you like spicy tuna, definitely try the Red Dragon roll. It's delicious!!

erEbDVZnaLsgpJY5cStQCw.text: Great ownership, sushi is fresh and the drinks are great! Will definitely come back it's a great neighborhood restaurant.

_g1tciedU-wDZFtQk9a15Q.text: Totally amazing! I was hesitant as I am more into traditional sushi places..sushiko and sushi sen, both also exceptional, but J's Kaiyo take this experience to a different level without compromising the quality and freshness of the sushi.I was so enthralled that I ordered the lamb ribs to go for dinner later on. Even after reheating they were OMG exceptional! This is definitely a place although I find a tad pricey I will most definitely frequent again and again.

PpLw26D5M1siZXgBPiDtTg.text: Two visits to this place, both take-out. had I written a review after the first visit, it would have been 4 or 5 stars.  Kung pao shrimp were fresh and delicious.  The steamed rice came in a separate container and was fluffy and very good.  Chicken fried rice had large pieces of chicken in it and was also fresh and tasty.  Next visit, i went for the shrimp again and an order of fried potstickers.  First off, the order came out within a very few minutes which meant the food was sitting there waiting to be served.  The potstickers were hard, tasteless and not at all fresh.  The shrimp dish was not nearly as good as my previous order and the rice was in the same container as the rest of the food.  It was clumped together, dry and had a hard crust. it may have been old sushi rice... i couldn't tell. I'm not sure I want to try a third time.   *****11/10/18 Despite what the owner has written about this review, it is not False...it is absolutely real and True.  The rice I got on my first visit ( which was within the past few weeks) was in a separate container and everything i wrote was fact.  I wasn't about to make a special trip back to the restaurant to complain....that's what yelp is for!  I am  not a competitor nor do I know any of Scott's competitors. If I were a competitor I wouldn't have said my first experience was a very good one..I am a customer with a legitimate complaint. I picked up the food myself and went directly home.  I also know what consistency potstickers and steamed rice should be - this was not my first encounter with Chinese food. Scott needs to attach himself to reality and get rid of his paranoia!

avHr5WUrPizlGTbCa_hp3Q.text: Best sushi in town without a doubt!  The fish is very fresh and good. This place is locally owned and operated by Jay who you will usually see behind the sushi bar, super nice guy. You must try this place if you are reading this review. You will not be disappointed!!

F52hnjX5f7o6REyZcFsvNg.text: Really excellent food, staff is professional and attentive. Been here twice and definitely will go back. Awesome happy hour!

wmBC0vbhztgFijHnTnfAWw.text: Reasonable sushi happy hour so I come here with my son for date night. Fresh fish. Good service. Can't complain.

vpEvCHk7gGUdugrliX7Jmw.text: We went in tonight during dinner hours and were seated quickly by our server. She was very friendly and was very patient with the time it took for us to order because it was our first time there. We ordered the pork rolls, Mongolian beef and the General Tsao chicken (one with white rice and the other with fried) and all three were excellent! There was not a long wait for the food at all, which was great because we were way past our hungry phase. The atmosphere was very pleasant with the music playing at just the right volume to still carry a conversation over dinner. The decor had a bit of a relaxing but fun aspect to it, very good for our once weekly date night. They have a very cute patio area which is going to be perfect for those beautiful spring days and nights. The owner is very pleasant and quite fun to chat with and he saw us out as we were leaving. Overall, this place is a wonderful addition to the neighborhood with great food and service to match. Strongly recommend, especially for a low key date night.

OiFuTivm9w6ECoaPL99PsA.text: This sushi bar is great! Everything we got off the menu was delicious and they had a good selection of traditional rolls and specialty rolls. Our waitress was very sweet and checked in often. The only thing I would add to the menu is plum wine  =]

N6g0-xakRVK1PTDUKiUdPw.text: The sushi is delicious, but the atmosphere is amazing! This place has like a super chill, kinda sexy SoCal vibe and I am LOVING it! Will be back many times!

Y1Qw33STLmQMcSb8zqMt6Q.text: The colleen roll tasted very fresh!  Loved it   And yep, I will definitely be back soon  Thanks

G1VpxrR9lZGPWwKgyBCU-w.text: This place is officially my new neighborhood favorite! They have a pretty decent Happy Hour, they have a kids menu, and the service was good. We were VERY happy with the sushi, and they also had some really interesting non-sushi items on happy hour. They also have rotating roll specials! The decor is awesome, and I am so excited to continue patronizing this place!!!

x26PPVQgzYmqcKa4ZIMTag.text: Wow first off let me say the service here.. phenomenal !!! I was greeted and felt like a regular, Scott was amazing! Now I had never even heard of this place, was just in the mood for sushi but I must say everyone should know about this place! The decor, the happy hour, the food, and the staff! Had an awesome rosemary infused Japanese whisky drink that was fun to see/help  make!  Our sushi was brought out beautifully portioned and had the right amount of everything in each.. some places add too much cream cheese to the philly rolls. But to each their own. I will definitely be coming back soon to try more!!

photos.caption: Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Philly Roll, Spicy Tuna Roll, Maki Las Vegas Roll, California tempura roll

pIocLJAB-g6BxI4t9wBfIA.text: Get ready for a doozy of a review.   This was probably the worst restaurant experience I have ever had. My friends and I sat down and were not spoken to for about 10 minutes, despite being told we could place our order before happy hour expired.   We finally get to order and it all seemed rushed. Nicole came, took our paper, and was practically running away before I could tell her the additional things we wanted. The only saving grace is we were charged happy hour prices. Or, so we thought.   Over the course of the next hour and a half, things started to take a turn for the worst. We were brought out some rolls, one of which we did not order. When we told our waitress, she said she was positive it was what we marked. Fine, we wanted to eat and get on with our night.   Our next part of the meal came out forty five minutes later. I ordered the Mongolian chicken, which was supposed to include "wok seared mushrooms." My mushrooms were raw and hard as a rock. Fine, I'm not going to complain.   While we were waiting for our nigiri, we overheard our waitress tell staff that she had forgotten to put in our order. Okay, we move on.   The real kicker came when we had already been there for an hour and a half, with no attention from our waitress, we waited around to ask for our bill. When it came, we noticed the rolls we thought we ordered were what we were charged for. Upon telling our waitress this, she replied with, "Well, what do you want now? Do you want the rolls or not?" We had already spent so much time there, we just wanted out.   When Nicole came to give us our check, she slammed it on the table, causing some things to knock down, and said nothing. We left, only to realize she overcharged us for one of the happy hour items.   We walked back and asked to speak to a manager about our experience. She told us that she was the manager and asked, "Why, what do you need?" She took money from her own pocket and gave us the difference in balance back, which I actually did appreciate.   Overall, if you have a ton of time on your hands for someone to give you something you didn't order cooked/prepared in a way that you didn't ask for, this might be the spot for you.

h8XbPd1W4BWmzzeaAqqbIg.text: Had dinner at Wok N Roll tonight.  The restaurant is very casual and laid back.  The decor is nice and seating is comfortable.  The staff is friendly and accommodating.  The menu is extensive and covers all Asian tastes. And...more importantly, the food is really good.  I highly recommend the Mongolian beef - the meat was tender and the sauce very tasty.  The black pepper chicken was also very tasty and vegetables cooked to perfection.  And I can't leave out the eggplant, one of my favorite dishes. I love eggplant.  Another big plus is that the restaurant is on Miller near Indian School (by Old Town) - a very convenient location with lots of parking!  I will be back soon.

cTQz2Vx6KfGvflr6PAQjng.text: Delicious food, our waitress Simi was amazing!! Whenever I come to Scottsdale I'm gonna try and stop by, i'm probably going to crave this Chinese food whenever I want some.

mDhFDo59411lCudbMLFDcw.text: A gem in the desert! The food was excellent and the service was top notch. I would definitely come back again when I am in the area.

XgD7A5hJUTv_3mWk_NtCVQ.text: Super friendly staff and easy method of Sushi tasting equals win win for sushi newbies.  I used a Groupon for a 5 course sushi meal to give this place a try.  Funny enough I've never noticed this place while I've done my TJ max shopping in the plaza.  The cucumber crab salad is great, sake gave a good little biz and the sushi was excellent.  I think the life on Mars was my favorite.  I had the key lime pie to take home.  I'd pass on that for next time but loved the quiet atmosphere and nonsense helpful staff.  Great Sunday night dinner.

JZV0se3xwmNro5zmtQtaUA.text: I do not know how this happened, but JsKaiyo became Wok and Roll, all new menu and staff, but retained JsKaiyo's Yelp reviews.  My good review was for JsKaiyo, which was truly good. The new restaurant, called Wok and Roll (at least that's what the banner says over the JsKaiyo sign, is nothing like the original. I am appealing to Yelp to erase the reviews done prior to the opening in September of this year. The sushi at Wok and Roll was not very good. The rice was hard and the salmon was fishy. The other dishes had the same thick (too much cornstarch) dark sauce. Edible but not great.  The service was inexperienced but really friendly and probably the best thing about the place. So please , Yelp, delete my other review which was for JsKaiyo, which I really miss.

25h5z6R6nwo1a2QiVDOoGg.text: This place deserves five stars only because of the great customer service. We walked in on a Thursday around 1:30 pm and the server was very friendly.   They have plenty of seating and you are allowed to pick the table of your choice. We sat down and the server quickly dropped off our menu.   The menu has a different array of sushi and they have various Chinese dishes as well. We ended up ordering from the Chinese side of the menu.   We ordered a chicken fried rice, a shrimp with broccoli dish, and we ordered a side of egg rolls with crab puffs. They have complimentary cucumber water and it actually tastes really good.   Our food came out some time after and it all looked and smelled pretty good. We dug into the shrimp dish and let me tell you... it was delicious!! The shrimp was cooked perfectly and had such a great charred flavor to it. It also had broccoli pieces and it came with white rice.   The chicken fried rice was a definite no. It was suppppppper salty. We ended up mixing some of our white rice into it to fix the salty situation, and it helped just a tiny bit. The crab puffs were a little too hard and dry for me, but the egg rolls were great! The only downside with the egg rolls was the weird sauce that came with them. It didn't taste so well and it was a weird pairing.   The server again was great but the food was ok. We  did love the shrimp dish though so that's what will bring me back again if I'm in the area.   5 stars because the server was friendly but minus two because our fried rice was too salty. Does the cook not sample what he puts out?

17fO1G-cXNWULFmMz_kX7w.text: My husband and I were looking at reviews after we had already sat down. Reviews were super mixed, but after experiencing it first hand we can side with the more it's a "mehhh" place. It is SUPER expensive for how little you get and how it's just ehh. We spent a little under 50$. Our beers were 7$ each, and they were so small! Some of the rolls were already falling apart once they came to our table. The Gyoza were really good, a little over fried but tasty. The sashimi my husband got was pretty good as well, but the rolls were just okay. Almost equivalent to buying it at the store (no offense).   After we sat down, it took about ten minutes to have our waiter come back to take our order. A couple at the bar who sat down after us got their food and such way before we did.   My husband and I play HQ, and it came on while we were waiting. The owner (I'm assuming), came to drop our gyoza off and saw the count down and said "are you timing us?".... Awkward, even if we were why be concerned...

G7NJJEgAr6NP-jl9oca08w.text: Worst experience ever! We are out-of-towners and encountered the worse service from manager/waitress, Nicky and also the owner, Scott. We decided Wok N Roll because it was closest to where we were staying with family. We ordered our drinks, proceeded with appetizers that took 20-30 minutes to get. We ordered steamed gyoza, it was cold and tasted uncooked. We also ordered from the Wok menu, requested noodles with veggies as well as chicken, and the choice of protein was orange chicken but only received plain noodles topped with orange chicken. It was so bland! Very dissatisfying. The service from Nicky just topped it off! She didn't check with us not once. No refills. Finished plates were not removed from the table. We had to ask another server to refill our drinks. She comes to our table, smacking the receipt on the table. It was asked to be split in three-ways and we kindly remonstrated to her about her service. She gives the excuse that she had another party she was attending and felt the need to say "that they did not complain" -- excuses!!! To make matters worst, we get the receipts divided incorrectly. We request for the owner after we asked for the manager, until then it was revealed she was and she failed completely to control the situation with her disgusting attitude. Should you be in the restaurant industry, customer service is your top priority! Owner, Scott, comes to our table (didn't introduce himself by the way) and fails to provide a proper apology. Terrible! I recommend if you are visiting from out of town, DO NOT GO HERE! -- the SERVICE was appalling.

PgODAgvmPs3UTKEV29UvNA.text: Disappointed. I live walking distance and just got around to trying this place. Sushi was ok, prices seemed kind of high for the quality. Service was mehhh. The restaurant itself is beautiful inside but I'm not their to eat the furniture. I'd rather get in my car and drive to 10 minutes to sushiholic.

wdp86NkypIuhfvFy6pfIIA.text: My bestie and I had lunch. The food was very good and clean. My bestie's food was not as crispy as she expected. The owner came to our table and was very pleasant and professional and wanted to make things great. What a nice experience.

iJTzBiD5Q5eSkusIsKjkoQ.text: The pork belly fried rice was delicious. The sweet and sour chicken was great but food of used an extra side of sauce. Shrimp chow mein - excellent. Oh! And the spring rolls. So yummy! Found our new place.

WQVTrcV1Qo4DFTVihJeybg.text: In the past I have enjoyed my meals at Wok N Roll but today I had a bad customer service experience which will most likely kept me from returning.  I came in and placed an order to go and paid for the tab with cash. The bill was $42.25 and I paid with $45. Anticipating that I most likely will leave the remaining amount as a tip I still like waiting for the change back and an itemized bill just to make sure everything is accurate. The hostess up front at the register handed me two dollars change back when clearly my receipt said my change was $2.75.  I inquired about the $.75 and she said oh we don't give out change here.  I re-asked for my additional change since my receipt clearly shows that I was supposed to get $2.75 in change. She examined two cast registers and shrugged her shoulders and said sorry there's no change in here. I made it clear that I expected what my receipt showed and she eventually (begrudgingly) came out and gave me my change. So beware of your receipt and your change as there seems to be some skimming happening.

UUuI1s-V7EESYscK4L8vUQ.text: Enjoyed the evening at J's Kaiyo last night.  The setting is cool and the service was friendly and good. It wasn't busy but sometimes that means lackluster service and that wasn't the case.  We enjoyed sitting at the sushi bar and had fun meeting some of the other customers which was encouraged by the staff.  The food was tasty. Fish fresh. There was a little something missing in the signature roll selection that we ordered though. They were abundant with variety, but didn't seem to create a cohesive taste.  I am a long time sushi lover and I order different items every where I go to try them out. I wasn't a total fan here, but I'd be willing to come back and try some other options and see if I can hit it better.

tHHS8vj6EY-pgksRvbnxpg.text: Fresh fish, friendly staff and they have alcohol now!  J's Kaiyo Sushi & Bar has my favorite sushi in the Scottsdale area so far. The fish was incredibly fresh, cut well, and served at the perfect temperature so that you could really taste the tuna and the salmon. The rice was properly done - none of that overly sweet Americanized nonsense you get at some places. They had a happy hour (until 6:30pm) so I tried an excellently executed salmon and avocado roll, as well as the pork gyoza. I was surprised the gyoza were deep fried but it actually went really with the yuzu miso sauce, which I could have easily poured over a bowl of rice and guzzled up. My banana whiskey cocktail was just the right amount of sweetness to go well with the gyoza too. I also tried the fresh uni nigiri (SO GOOD) and the King of Persia roll which was very nice with the garlic ponzu and fried green onion. Overall, just everything was good and the miso sauce made me want to try more of the kitchen menu as well as the sushi. Definitely recommend checking this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Wok 'N Roll Chinese-Sushi-SW Asian - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Perfect salmon avocado hand roll

8CJy_DQv2HUHd3TqQHyrxg.text: This is the kind of place we've been looking for, clean, good food, at a reasonable price, and service from someone who knows what they're doing. We got it here at Wok N Roll. Our server, Sande, was outstanding and friendly. We started with appetizers of egg rolls and fried dumplings, which were excellent, and hot. Our entree's of beef Chow Mein and chicken Pad Thai followed and were very plentiful (if it's not spicy enough for you simply ask for chili oil). Both were made from fresh quality ingredients, tender meat, and were hot as well.  If you're into sports TV, they have plenty of televisions and will tune to what you want. There are plenty of options in Scottsdale but, this is one we'll be coming back to. We really liked it!  Don't hesitate to stop, you won't be disappointed!

hI2cogUNFwObJe95qZnUfA.text: This is my favorite locally owned sushi bar in Scottsdale! The seafood products are extremely fresh and flown in daily from all over the world! Not only is the presentation of food plating unique, colorful & beautiful but is extremely delicious as well! The daily specials at this restaurant never disappoint! They help keep the menu interesting and help me to expand my palette by constantly trying new things. To compliment the amazing food here are specialty cocktails & a large variety of yummie cold sake! (My favorite is the Sayuri then Hakasuru!)-these are a must try! The vibe here is chill yet fun and the owner is always around the restaurant which gives this place a more homey & intimate feel. Plus, who doesn't think it's cool to meet the owner when you go out to dinner?! If you haven't been here then you're missing out! I would recommend this hidden gem to anyone & everyone!!  Oops! Almost forgot to mention the great deals on happy hour! Everyday 430-6pm. So check it out if you're ballin' on a budget! It will be worth every penny plus some
