sPZdfDqBmI5YZrFLgpS23w.text: Jay, Kaiyo's namesake, is no longer with this group -- read into this what you will about this place -- rendering an entirely different experience altogether: the quality of the fish seems to have completely changed and it's presentation on the plate has been particularly inconsistent.  It's quite incredible when such a promising new establishment so immediately alters its own trajectory.  My last two experiences generated the same response: "WTF?".  It's fallen off my list of Must-Haves and made my list for Stay-Away.

h44UIPeY0737BC2A2pef9w.text: I thought it odd that a sushi restaurant opened right next to another sushi restaurant. And that it renovated a former fast food joint, just like the other sushi place. But apparently, the owner from the former, Sushi J, moved and opened up another place right next door. So I guess J's Kaiyo Sushi is where the original chef came from.  The interior is so much more beautiful. Very modern and chic. They didn't have a liquor license  when we went, so hopefull that has gone through.  I ordered what I normally ordered....the Marilyn Monroll, and the other "low carb" rolls. All are very big yet equally delicious.  I'm sure there's more to come from this sushi chef!

ad5HAJL4eC0n6Dp-nsy7bw.text: Super bummed when we went in last night.  We live across the street and come to J's Kaiyo or order take-out pretty often.  Last night, the food was awesome as usual.  But the service was bad.  :(  The sushi chef was not friendly at all.  We only saw her smile one time and it was to her co-worker, never a customer.  She handed us food over the counter without a word...  Which is weird and almost rude.  Didn't say, "Here is your Loli roll," (which the Loli is amazing!) or anything.  Just held it over the counter, looked the other way, and waited for us to take it.  Maybe she was having a bad day??? No need to provide bad customer service though. We sit at the sushi bar for a reason, we enjoy watching and interacting.

rKreV-1-2wJ73gTxoRh0fg.text: Great chinese food for me I love the pork fried rice and kung pao chicken. My wife loves the sushi its the best of both worlds! Chinese and Sushi!

lGUKVbIzzeWEKHJnfrGRvQ.text: Yesssss! Yesss! YES! Words cannot express how thrilled I am that this place finally opened!! I came in for the opening night and was not disappointed! The head chef is AMAZING and you can tell he really knows his art! The management team and servers were all very helpful and friendly, which made for the fun/hip vibe. The atmosphere is very open and inviting and the perfect spot for dinner with a group of friends! They also have a great patio which will be perfect for those AZ summer nights!! (Just crossing my fingers they make it dog friendly )  The food is incredible! Super fresh and great quality! If you have a spicy side do yourself a favor and try the fire in the mouth roll! Health nut? The lollipop is for you! I'm also a huge fan of the chirashi bowl and the sashimi style dishes like the yellowtail carpaccio! Speaking of yellowtail... order the Hamachi Kama (aka yellowtail collarbone) it's broiled and takes a little time to cook, but it's well worth the wait!!!   Yes, the star of this place really is the sushi but they also have a ton of other non-sushi style options on the menu! Try the chicken katsu and udon noodles... both are delish!!!  Needless to say this is my new favorite sushi spot in Scottsdale!! I'm looking forward to checking out the happy hour in the near future! Yum yummmmm keep up the great work!! #getinmybelly

The rice is perfect, but they don't stuff you with it, they actually give you healthy portions of fish!!!  The staff is really cool and friendly.  We just moved from another part of town and are so glad to be back!  Downtown Scottsdale is the best and so is J's Kaiyo!  See you every Friday!

dHFcfw-eQdd2ono67KForg.text: Excellent happy hour, friendly staff that aim to please.  My favorite roll is Colleens Dream, some of the proceeds go to a great cause as well!. Dedicated owner and awesome sushi chef make this place stop notch.  $7 Happy hour sake bomb!

WhVuNpPlYh8HZJk1wpE20w.text: I gave this place 2 chances. Last Friday the edamami was some what "cold" and "hard." First time I have someone serve weird edamami. I went back today. We had to return one plate because they assumed we wanted the spicy yellow tail. Also, we did get the special of the day Orange Chicken. Nothing special at all. I will have to continue going to Indian Bend and Hayden even though it is further away. The waitress had 2 tables and at one point my friend and I were waiting for our green tea refills. Food is mediocre, nothing special. Price is high!!!!!

addcY1REZjAkO3tquyrSfg.text: We went for happy hour on Saturday January 26 and we had a great time.  We stayed until 8:30 sitting out on the patio drinking sake bombers and talking.  Our waitress was great, she came by whenever we needed her even out on the patio.  The food was very good, particularly the Las Vegas roll.  My wife also loved the Pad Thai with chicken, and she brought home over half of it because she couldn't eat it all.  The California roll I had was also good, but the crab and cream cheese puffs were outstanding and are made in house so they are very fresh and crispy - we had two orders.  We will definitely return.

VGCDrJRN_rXleorxsntZlw.text: This place has never got off the ground. It sad because every time I have come here in the past the service at least has been pretty good. But now even that has gone down hill. All the waitresses are to busy socializing to even seat the few customers they have. Such a shame, this place could have been a unique spot. The second shoe chefs are also terrible. All the rolls look like my 4 yo made them!!!!!!

kHN7h8ivkS0GIqpIflpqmQ.text: Amazing miso, edaname and keto friendly sushi.  Eating low carb can be a challenge when eating out but I had so many options and can't wait to go back.  Service was superb.

_U1huLVrhAeiSheRn8X0Jw.text: Delicious sashimi, toro, sea bream, tuna, salmon, octopus, yellowtail. Pricing is around 80-100 for two people (that's a sashimi platter, eel, cucumber salad, edamame, one roll, and tea to drink) We'll be back!

h6_C-CeSIm904g6coOYabA.text: The best General Tso's Chicken around. Light on breading, chicken is tender and the sauce is great. I order mine with broccoli instead of rice. They also have an everyday 11-7 happy hour for incredible alcohol prices. Saki bomber (large bottle Sapporo and a small hot sake) for only $7!! Been here many times and will keep coming!

N2gGtB0q4oJ6Gah_1db8FA.text: This is in my top worst restaurant experiences ever. My 2 friends and I are in town on vacation and decided to try this place after seeing such great reviews, but it turns out there is new ownership of the establishment and it has all gone downhill from there. It took over an hour to get all the food we ordered and the restaurant wasn't even busy. Our server was very unprofessional (yelling at coworkers in front of us, never checking up on our table, shouting from the bar, mistakenly giving us another roll we did not order and when we told her it was incorrect she told us that WE were incorrect, forgetting our nigiri, slammed our check down on the table, and overcharged us). When asked to speak to a manager, Nicole said she was the manager. Luckily she gave us the difference of the incorrectly charged item back but we just wanted to get out of there at that point. My food was okay, but one of my friends plates had raw mushrooms on it. The terrible service isn't worth the mediocrity of the food, for me at least, but it could be for you! Also, if you need some entertainment, look for the owner's petty responses of some of the bad reviews.

fKnvu0r4mBVXvY98LgYCfA.text: New ownership, trying to do too much. The Chinese food is disgusting and the once delicious sushi is just average. Very sad to have lost our favorite place.

wmoz_g1X6Q-3LB00r-jXLQ.text: One of my favorite sushi restaurants! Amazing food but additionally such a good environment. Great for dates, pregaming...etc The price point is stellar especially for drinks. I'm surprised they stay open so late! Lastly the customer service is stellar. Officially my neighborhood go to

2_nT2CpU9zgBFt2lv5OaPw.text: Great service, solid food. The owner was an awesome dude. All the food was delicious. I'd go back there anytime

GLI-vTCfCpODnil_L1uORg.text: I have been looking for a good local Chinese/ Sushi place for awhile...my mother and I went for HH and were warmly greeted as soon as we walked in ...we chose to sit at the comfy bar....we had the IPA on draft,he BEST chicken tostadas I've ever had in my life!! Slightly spicy!and some sushi rolls which were presented beautifully and tasted fresh...we met Scott the owner who was extremely welcoming...it was so good I wanted to go back the next day! I will be back with some friends and try some more items on the menu.

W8ulpOz4piI2z_aU_tm81A.text: While on a Business Trip, I went to this place! The service from beginning to end was amazing! The lady serving me was awesome! Ambiance was awesome, good relaxing place! Food was good, I ordered vegetable Udon! I added Tofu on top of it which was the star of the dish.  Why one star less because the dish was bit too much sweet for my taste! Soup was sweet! Now that might be my taste and may be broader audience like this taste, so I would recommend go to this place and try there wide variety of dishes!

FQRILf1mxeReedv2UXnpVQ.text: Great food & service. I would definitely recommend trying this place out! The prices are fair & the food is delicious! So happy this has been brought to the area.

QOPWmHq7oPF_cBxp5FA7vA.text: We had a great meal for a reasonable price.  Great Happy Hour wine price.  Wonderful service .  Ample servings to take home some for tomorrow! The fried rice with shrimp had lots of shrimp perfectly cooked and the dumpling soup had lots of dumplings.  We will return

Bb2gjzZEq6iCCbs5JVEW2Q.text: Nikki is the shizzzzz love dat girl. Cool spot. They have good specials. And the food is good. Could be a good pregame spot :)

9K5IuXN6RbxmmEVdX1APag.text: Close to Oldtown so it's a cool spot to pregame. Great music and delicious sushi! I would definitely recommend!

4MgJMes363RM3xpCSyPXlA.text: Loved the food, drinks, and service! Came to visit Arizona for the week and found this gem. Great prices for the food as well along with the portions. Loved our waitress who also made the drinks for us -- which were AWESOME!

F7DdgrU4D2Z9VmQJeXhGXA.text: Chinese food was terrible, the walnut shrimp was recommended by the owner as the preferred menu item... it was fishy and gross. The pork fired rice we couldn't even eat. Was hoping for so much more but just let down.

hunIgf2ym006WvvqHHpm0w.text: I had the chicken pad thai dish and it is absolutely one of the best dishes ever!  Kudos to owner Scott Stuart for making this place a happening spot for fine asian food dining.  Oh and there is live music performances Thursday through Saturday.

nhZOWh_01yFm_cL58Y6ZEA.text: Stopped in for lunch about a week ago and am so glad I did! Close to my office and will definitely be our new lunch spot!! Tried the Dan Dan noodles and they were not only delicious, but super reasonably priced. My office mates have raves about the sushi, looking forward to trying the rest of the menu. You can tell the food is great quality. It's nice to have such a wonderful option close to old town that isn't a tourist trap. Scott the owner is a very nice guy and we're looking forward to supporting this place!

u9dKVwQ6VB12M2uO5ImGWA.text: The owner was friendly and greeted me at the door. I was getting a to-go order and I waited at the bar. The waitress came and asked me if I wanted anything and I said some green tea. I never got the green tea. The sushi chef was nice. They seem to have trouble checking out my order with their computers and I got a little flustered and forgot to mention that she never brought me the green tea. It was expensive and not really that amazing. Besides that,  the experience of the service was flustering. I don't think I will be back. Reading the other reviews I don't think I'm missing anything with the Chinese food.

63G1vu_rDUWcQGjz4iSCiQ.text: OMG GREAT SUSHI.....in AZ...FINALLY!!! Had dinner at the bar with my gf last weekend and I literally stuffed my face and couldn't stop eating even though I was SO full. (You know how that is with sushi) Of course we over ordered and ate it all! Thank you Chef Todd for making us our amazing meal and impeccable service!   Super fresh fish and great selection of special rolls that aren't trendy and lame. Definitely more of an old school meets modern version of sushi at an affordable price for what you get.   The restaurant is crazy CUTE! I do not know how they converted this place from an Arby's to what it's transformed to now. It's tucked away in the Sprouts center near Zipp's off of Camelback and Miller Rd. So a nice quieter departure from the Old Town scene.   Go here now! You won't regret it!
